Dear Joshua,

When you want to use Cantera in your own programs, it is not =
enough to
just download cantera153.msi, because this contains only already
=
compiled things. You have to donwload "cantera-1.5.3-src.zip" unzip it
to a=
ny place (c:\cantera-1.5.3) and compile. To make this you need
beside the c=
ompiler also an development environment which provide you
with some compile=
r tools (shell, make etc.). I use msys
(http://www.mingw.org/). After insta=
llation of this, follow the given
instructions for unix to compile Cantera.=
 Then you have all libraries
and include-files in the target directory (e.g=
.
c:\cantera-1.5.3\build\).

ulf


-----Urspr=FCngliche Nachricht-----
Von:=
 Joshua Pence [mailto:joshua.pence@...] 
Gesendet: Donnerstag, 27.=
 Mai 2004 17:35

Betreff: [cantera] Cantera.h


=
I am having a bit of a problem with compiling Cantera in Dev-C++.

Apparent=
ly, I do not have the 'Cantera' header file ('Cantera.h') on my
system, alt=
hough I have downloaded it (Cantera153) off sourceforge
several times.  It =
simply isn't in here.  Do I need other software than
the package that is av=
ailable on sourceforge?  

Joshua
